description: This course provides a social history of China in the modern period, emphasizing the role of religious and local associations in the transformations of local society in the Ming and Qing periods. The course will explore the rise of the family-lineage form in China and in the Chinese diaspora in Southeast Asia, while also looking at temples, regional associations, merchant and ritual specialist organizations, and sectarian religious movements.
title: Chinese Local Society: Religion and Lineage
